lines.text: We were a nice snapshot but never a family portrait.
You mustn't mind Woody, her mind's always on the tip of her tongue.

And I had an opportunity to see what happened when freedom was destroyed. The first step was always the same. They began by putting a blanket over education. And by making it a crime for people to think. That's what the film is about. Actual newsreel shots of some of the dreadful things that have happened in our time. How they burned the books and sent the scholars into slave labor camps. How they hang the teachers by their feet in the public squares because they dared to teach the truth. Do you think I want to see that happen in this country?
I should have known from her voting record in Congress, there was something in her past.
You don't get expelled for staying out all night, unless there is a man connected with it. Who was it, Ag?
Doesn't the president have anything to say about it?
Oh yes, of course, but only if Mr. Griswold has said it first.
This overwhelming desire to return to the past... girlhood memories, old pictures, old sofas, old sweethearts. Old hat!
You've been on war fronts so long that a decent atmosphere is bound to seem a little incongruous.
Open your eyes, Aggie. This is a lost world up here. And Merrill's the perfect president for it.
I know who you are. You're here to cause trouble, that's who you are.
Come on, Mary Nell, let's leave Miss Reed alone with her memories.
Miss Reed is alone with her memories; outside under a tree.
Then who're...
Me? I just carry the typewriter.
Oh, you're her secretary! Oh, I'm so glad!
Well, don't shoot off any firecrackers!

[Seeing Agatha searching the desk drawer]
May I ask what you're doing?
There's a secret compartment in this desk; I used to keep brownies in it to hide them from Ellie.
Who's Ellie?
My roommate. You share your clothes, your perfume, and even your themes with your roommate , but never your...
[Pulling out a tin, and opening it]
brownies!
Zooks! they must be stale!

[chewing]
Fresh this week. go on, have one.
No thanks. They stick to my teeth.
If you'll excuse me, I have some fudge in my briefcase.
